news_header: In 2024, only 8% of U.S. teens and tweens reported using tobacco products, marking the lowest usage in 25 years, according to the National Youth Tobacco Survey.
news_text: The 2024 National Youth Tobacco Survey reveals that only 8% of middle and high school students in the U.S., approximately 2.25 million, reported using any tobacco products in the past 30 days, a significant decrease from 23% in 2019. E-cigarettes remain the most popular tobacco product among teens, used by 6% of students, followed by nicotine pouches at nearly 2%. The survey highlights ongoing disparities in tobacco use among different racial and ethnic groups, with tobacco use often beginning in adolescence, which can adversely affect brain development. Tobacco control programs have played a crucial role in reducing usage rates.
